result.execSummary:
The defendant Chrystal M Kuzel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Sentence may be transferred to Washington County.

AS OF 9/18/2015: Probation amended to 1 year.
Concurrent with: 14CF866

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to be paid to the Jewelry Center as a Condition of Probation along with RT surcharges.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. Maintain absolute sobriety. Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.

Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
No contact with Kohl's or Breanne M.
Attend 2 self help classes/meetings per week.
DNA surcharge is WAIVED.
Case 15CF527 was dismissed and read into: 14CF833 and 14CF866.
**01/20/16 COURT WILL ALLOW POSSESSION OF ALCOHOL AS IT PERTAINS TO WORK PURPOSES ONLY, SO LONG AS AUTHORIZED BY AGENT**

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Chrystal M Kuzel in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Amended Information filed - reading waived.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Withheld sentence for 3 years Probation - concurrent to 14CF866 - Sentence maybe transferred to Washington County
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Restitution of $300.00 to be paid to Jewelry Center as a Condition of Probation. 
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.   No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. No contact with Kohl's or Breanne M..  Two self-help classes per week.   DNA, surcharge is waived.
Letter filed by third party with attached family photo.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 19, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Chrystal M Kuzel in court, in custody, with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Atty. Perkins makes a Motion for Modification of bail. Atty. Perkins requests bail modification. Atty. Perkins stated the defendant is looking to get into a treatment plan but needs to clear up a pending case in Washington County Case #13CM1112, warrant has been outstanding for 6 months and sentence is pending. Court orders defendant be produced in Washington County. Sheriff to transport her after the hearing in Washington County back to Waukesha immediately. Atty. Perkins withdraws the plea.  Bail modification will be addressed at a later date.  Bail remains as fixed. 

  Arraignment scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
